intro: Epilobium diversifolium, commonly known as the variable willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves that vary in shape and size. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats like wetlands and stream banks, and is often found in disturbed soils. Epilobium diversifolium is also used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in gardens.
